meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dark.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with darknesses after the lights went out.
meanings.sent2: She was afraid of the darknesses that enveloped the forest at night.
meanings.sent3: The darknesses seemed to play hide and seek with the shadows.
meanings.sent4: In the darknesses of her mind, she found solace and peace.
meanings.sent5: The darknesses of the cave were so thick, she could almost touch them.

meanings.sent1: The deep darknesses of the cave made it hard to see anything.
meanings.sent2: He stumbled in the darknesses of the tunnel, unable to find his way.
meanings.sent3: The darknesses of the room seemed to swallow up everything in its path.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of the darknesses was like a weight pressing down on her chest.
meanings.sent5: The darknesses of the night sky were filled with twinkling stars.

meanings.sent1: She painted the room in deep darknesses to create a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The artist used different darknesses to add depth to the painting.
meanings.sent3: The darknesses of the fabric made it perfect for the gothic-themed party.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were drawn to the darknesses of the storm clouds gathering above.
meanings.sent5: The darknesses of the forest canopy created a cool, shady spot to rest.
